instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hi to all...i have this motherboard with orange ligth.

connecting it to my power supply (15v@3a) i have a bootloop like 0,022 0,0055 0,0015

After testing all the power aliases page i think I am missing my S0 enables which looks like I need <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> is 0v ,the line is not shorted. if i remove <RESISTOR>R8178</RESISTOR>, it goes to 3,3v.

could you help me to find the problem?

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> pulses at least?
Did you test SMC bypass mode?

Inspect <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion.
Check its pins 7 & 3 for pulse.
Is more easy to trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check the reaction.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
found pad <SIGNAL>SPI_CS0_L</SIGNAL> interrupted

after i have fixed it, macbook has start working !!
